criteria: Understanding of Place Value (Tens and Ones)
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of place value. Cannot identify tens or ones in a two-digit number.
Student shows minimal understanding. Struggles to identify tens and ones, often confusing them.
Student demonstrates basic understanding. Can identify tens and ones in simple cases but struggles with numbers 11-19.
Student demonstrates satisfactory understanding. Can generally identify tens and ones, including numbers 11-19, but may make occasional errors.
Student demonstrates strong understanding. Can accurately identify tens and ones in any two-digit number and explains the composition of numbers 11-19.
Student demonstrates excellent understanding. Can explain place value concepts clearly, accurately identifies tens and ones, and can apply this knowledge to solve related problems.
Student cannot explain how numbers 11-19 are composed of a ten and ones.
Student attempts to explain the composition but lacks clarity and accuracy.
Student can identify that numbers 11-19 have tens and ones but cannot explain the exact composition (e.g., one ten and some ones).
Student can generally explain that numbers 11-19 are made of one ten and a certain number of ones, but may lack precision.
Student accurately explains the composition of numbers 11-19 as one ten and a specific number of ones.
Student clearly and thoroughly explains the composition of numbers 11-19, providing examples and demonstrating a strong grasp of the concept.
Student cannot apply place value knowledge to any related task or problem.
Student struggles to apply place value knowledge and is unsuccessful in most attempts.
Student can apply place value knowledge to simple tasks with guidance.
Student can apply place value knowledge to most tasks, although may require some assistance.
Student can independently and accurately apply place value knowledge to a variety of tasks.
Student demonstrates mastery in applying place value knowledge to complex tasks and can explain the reasoning behind their solutions.
